Reviews.Title: “Great gym!”
Reviews.Author: MatteoBelletti
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel! I booked a single studio but at my arrival the girl at the desktop told me that they upgrated me in a room little bit big...amazing!the room was a big apartment with 4 bathroom,2 bedroom,1 big kitchen and a very big room with plasma tv!fantastic! The gym of the hotel is free as per sauna and steam room!the gym is very good!the person at the reception are very friendly. The restaurant is good and also the breakfast is not bad. I paid only 100 € each night during the boat show!

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Cell”
Reviews.Author: leshaswell
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I was only staying in the Tamani for two nights. My cell, sorry room - no I was right the first time was a small L shaped area with a toilet/shower area, a little galley kitchen (not sure why) a small desk with a hard wooden chair and what would be classed in the UK as a three quarter bed. More of a Prince sized bed than a King Sized. The shower cubicle was about 30" square with a shower curtain which immediately attached itself to my rear end and refused to let go. I had a bath towel and a bath mat - one of each, the first night and had to ring housekeeping the second night to get even that. There were no pictures or anything on the pained walls,, just a couple of scuff marks. My room was on the third floor at the front of the hotel and I was not happy that Jensen Button was practicing hill starts outside most of the night. If not him then that Michael bloke. Getting the picture - yes your right, I was less than impressed, a lot less. To be fair the food in the restaurant was good and the staff there were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “If you insist they treat you well”
Reviews.Author: HermJP
Reviews.Content: We arrived there with seven hrs delay, had sent a mail to the hotel to keep our rooms, they confirmed by mail that they hold them but they had sold them and the hotel was fully booked when we arrived 8:00am in the morning instead of the night before. They wanted to gibe my partner a room (chamber) in the business center with a bed and me a suite with a surcharge. I refused the surcharge and they accepted and my biz partner also got a suite that afternoon. Big and spacey, the hotel is a bit far away from the center and the walk to the metro is 15 - 20 min's rather than the 5 mentioned on the net. All in all, eventually a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: welli d
Reviews.Content: Great hotel ,,I booked 2 bed room apartment ,nice living room with dinning table Huge room,very clean, you can see very good view of dubai and very good location..all the staff are friendly and helpful ..definitely ,,I will say "YES" to go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: gilwernboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2012 for 7 nights on business. Hotel is located 10 minutes from beach, half hour from centre of Dubai, 40 minutes from airport. Staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. Restaurant is pleasant, although we only used it for coffees. Lifts were fast and plentiful. We booked two of their single studio rooms. Rooms were dated but clean and fine for what we wanted - just somewhere to put our head down each night. Unfortunately the studio rooms are situated right above the garage, and the smell in the corridor leading to the rooms is like walking through the engine room of a ship. Very strong fumes and constant smell of diesel. Fortunately smell did not permeate into the rooms. It's a shame, as the smell spoiled what would otherwise have been a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think it can't be that bad....”
Reviews.Author: BHendriks
Reviews.Content: Learn from my mistake... I had to book a room in Dubai but was "late" as I booked 7 weeks ahead of time using Expedia, the 4 star Tamani Hotel Marina. Normaly I take a Marriott but the Tamani was only a 3rd of the price and I thought to smart. Reading the rates at the Expedia I should had have doubts as a +/-20% complained at a 4/10 while others reported roughly 8/10, my mistake to believe the last group. The receptionists are all lovely but not really smart/honest. Knowing the negative rating from a few guests I told them I would not be pleased with a room they stayed in. That was not the case they told me, but what they gave me? Room 301, white stone dirty floor, I think 15 square meter bedroom and 6 in the bathroom. Airco blew air but not cold, separate water heating system for the shower, noisy above imagination. I thought not to complain and just enjoy this hell hole however the whole night I could hear people so clearly if they where next to me. Also they where working with loud machinery and I could hear cars. On top of that the smell of food, the whole night! The morning after I complained and asked another room but sort fully booked. Night number two, same story and I stated my Indiana Jones adventure on floor #3. At 11pm I found out that my floor was next to a big separation door and behind this unlocked door in the hallway there was a car parking....it seemed that the first 3 floors of the building where originally build as a car-park but they changed that to rooms however not all. Dangerous, against any safety regulation I can think of and not the last not really a comfortable location for any guest you would say? I ventilated my anger to the reception desk but no way that I got another room, fully booked sir! Next morning I complained again and asked for the duty manager, not on duty, sorry sir please call us after 9. So I did but after 15 minutes talking to every member of the reception desk they understood I was not pleased and got the director on the phone. He apologized and arranged to provide me another room on the same floor. #326, same price but 50 sq. meter, clean, airco that works and close to the emergency exit what I asked for before I even booked as I have a hotel fire experience. So what did we learn? Always take a hotel from a known global chain, Marriott or Hilton has a high standard and corporate control. It helps to complain and keep on doing that until they solve the problem. If people are spending time writing a negative review there is a reason, trust me!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious apartment with great views”
Reviews.Author: Fiona S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Xmas & New Year with hubby & 2 kids. We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the 37th floor - clean, very spacious and fantastic view. We had no problems during our stay, any requests to housekeeping or room-service were dealt with quickly and politely. Fantastic location and no shortage of taxis at the foyer. Only downside for me was that the outdoor pool got no sunshine, that said JBR beach is only 5 mins away. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: Radsad
Reviews.Content: Very poor service. Complimentary breakfast was like a fishmarket and we did not get napkins or plates. Had to call housekeeping several times for the washer/ dryer yet our problem did nor get solved. There are many great places to stay in Dubai so don't waste your time & money here.

Reviews.Title: “Got a free upgrade to a three bedroom flat”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed A
Reviews.Content: Views are great, very spacious and beautiful rooms. You can see the Westin and the palm from the rooms. I didnt have time to check their pools as we stayed one night there only. but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Njoks
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a holiday in dubai and the hotel was not a disappoint at all... The Apartments r huge n spacious enough for the kids to run around! The cleanliness was very good. The service was great with friendly staff. Overall i enjoyed staying at the Tamani Marina and recommend it for those with families.

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: BIM_in_tour
Reviews.Content: My reservation was for a standard single room but I was given a very large apartment for the same rate, as the single rooms were fully booked. The view was not amazing as my view was in the opposite side of the the Palm Jumeirah. The breakfast is very large but expensive. Staff was very kind. Many taxis are awaiting at the hotel's door and the metro station is near.

Reviews.Title: “5 star ??”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my trip to Dubai staying at the Tamani Hotel Marine. I booked this hotel at Lastminute Secret Hotel described as a five star hotel. The room I was first given was worse then some Blackpool B and B. Smelly and very grubby and I did'nt want to even unpack my bag. After I complained to the front desk I was given a far suprior room which I would expect from a five star hotel. If the description says 5 star, all the rooms should be 5 star standard not just some of them. Be wary of booking this hotel if you get a bad room then it is all ways worth complaining dont settle for crap. The Hotel is a great location for the beach front and and the Ski Dome and Emirates Shoping Mall is a short,cheap taxi ride away and a short walk to the metro sation.

Reviews.Title: “My visit to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Nader N
Reviews.Content: I will certainly be recommending Tamani to my friends and hope that we can return some time.I’ve been staying in one of the suites on the 34th floor which has an amazing view to the Palm Jumeirah. The hotel is in a very good location, it is close to the shopping malls, Marina Walk and just across the beach. it's a busy hotel have to wait to check in to my room for a while, however the staff recommended to me their restaurant, which is really good by the way, and I enjoyed the food as been so tired after the flight.There are two pools in the hotel, indoor and outdoor. In indoor pool there are too many kids, so I preferred to stay in outdoor pool. the hotel employees are so kind even if every body seems to be so busy

Reviews.Title: “Average of the mill...”
Reviews.Author: metcalve
Reviews.Content: A rather average of the mill kind of property. This "hotel" basically caters more to long-term guests rather than short-term tourists. Check-in was a disaster because of 2 things: 1) check-in receptionist was attending to me, but decided to assist her colleague with her check-in, so decided to just tick some boxes on the check-in form and slam it in front of me WHILE talking to the guest from the next counter, expecting me to auto-pilot and know what to do with it. 2) the room wasn't ready at 2.45pm, when the email confirmation clearly stated 2pm. She even tried to come up with a 3pm check-in rule until I pointed it out to her that it is not what was sent to me. Was sent away to "wait for an hour" for the room to be ready. While waiting at the lobby, she came up to me later and offered some complimentary drinks at the coffee house Nar and Hail (interesting name for a cafe), and the keys to the room duly sent to me at the cafe about 30 minutes thereon. Room was nothing to scream about except that it is as huge as the website say it will be. It is a serviced apartment after all (not a hotel suite as they make you believe). Housekeeping definitely needs more training to clean the room, from the window sill to the carpets to the kitchen utensils to the sofa... 4 toilets (2 with bath facilities, 1 with standing shower, 1 powder type room). The standing shower and powder room smells of sewerage it would make you go crazy spending more than 2 minutes in there. Called reception during the stay to enquire about free parking for guests, but she either didn't understand the simplest of English, or the staff here are just trained to annoy you. When I asked about free parking, I had to repeat it a few times, before she snapped back at me "free parking of what?!". It felt like a 'how many receptionsts does it take to change a lightbulb' moment. I gave up talking to her. Went to my car and drove away, and yes, it is free. The spa facilities are what you would expect of an overly used shared condominum. Jacuzzi doesnt work, and the indoor pool is full and uninviting when you have 3 people in it. Outdoor pool too cold for swimming this time of the year. Sauna and steam is there, decent. Check-out was another fiasco with one of the rudest receptionist I have ever met. Was told to wait for housekeeping to check the room, waited for about 15 minutes before I went up to the reception and was told to wait somemore, before another staff member said the call already came 10 minutes ago and the room is ok. Communication obviously doesn't rank very highly with the hotel. Overall an extremely unpleasant stay. Will avoid this like the plague. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Thank you Ihab!”
Reviews.Author: doscal
Reviews.Content: I stay in Dubai quite alot - have stayed in Grosvenor House, Le Royal Meridien, Quarmadeen, Al Manzil, Crowne Plaza, Fairmont etc etc etc. This hotel is as good as any and provides better value than all I have experienced. I checked in at 3am and Ihab at reception made me feel welcome and provided me with everything I needed. Excellent employee, Tamani! This hotel is in an excellent location. A short walk / taxi from the beach, the fantastic Dubai Marina and for the night life lovers, its just across the road from Barasti (look it up). There is a supermarket around the corner from the hotel..well theres two actually, which is a great help also. The pool area is nice and well maintained and the staff are generally helpful and polite. I will definitely stay here again. Mr Walid Al-Awa, well done! I hope to see you guys soon - I will recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: nadeemk
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star accomodation as claimed rather max 3 star. Staff not very cooperative.Rooms very tiny. This is like bed and break fast apartment tower not a real hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nasser”
Reviews.Author: nasser a
Reviews.Content: My stay at tamani hotels was totally satisfactory, clean and comfortable with very friendly staff. The reception was modern and welcoming. Room service was prompt and with a smile. I stayed in high floor and the view also very nice. I realy recoment this hotel to my friends and room charge also not that much expensive,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Modern and Luxurious...”
Reviews.Author: Shokat S
Reviews.Content: While residing in Kuwait, we frequently visited Dubai on business and family vacations. Let's be clear.. There is some construction going on that will eventually be complete, but once inside this magnificently decorated 5 star hotel, you will be instantly relaxed from the reception area all the way to your suite. Depending on which floor, which wing and what size suite you book, your stay will certainly be well worth it. We were fortunate to have been guests at the Tamani Marina on multiple occasions, on different floors and wings. The 2 and 3 bedroom suites are your villa away from home. They are luxuriously furnished with breathtaking views of the Palms on the Marina wing. The indoor solarium with heated pool and jacuzzi is a blast for the kids. We transferred twice from 2 other popular 5 star hotels to be guests at the Tamani. Highly competent staff, friendly, helpful and willing to go the extra mile to make your stay more comfortable. The Manager of this establishment is a remarkable person who is always visible and willing to assist when needed. We definitely stay at the Tamani on my next visit...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but not the top”
Reviews.Author: khg1972
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with my family it meet the basic features for its level but not reach to my expectations good point that it is free from alcohol as i read before in other review the view through windows is not possible because of its dirty status overall it is good but i prefer to try other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Better then Maid's Quarters”
Reviews.Author: Streetjay
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with my stay in this hotel. I had booked a room through an Internet-based travel website. I was surprised to see such an amazing rate at a "five star hotel." I guess not all rooms in a five star need to be high level. Firstly, I think the special rate is reserved for rooms that were probably intended to be staff quarters in the original design of the hotel. My room was tiny. The bathroom was not only minuscule, the shower curtain smelled like urine and there were hairs on the toilet when I checked into the room. The room had a kitchenette with fridge, electric kettle, instant coffee/tea, glasses and cutlery. And there is a Carrefour Supermarket right next door. The location is convenient to Dubai Marina. The decorative features were obviously cut to fit such a small room. The drapes, furniture and bedding were nice, however, the finishes were not (such as the tile floor of the room which looked like it belonged in a bathroom). House keeping was very friendly. Most of the staff at the front desk did not even think to interrupt their gossip session when I arrived or approached them for advice (there were two guest services members who were the exception). I am not sure if there is public access to the beach from this hotel. Luckily I had a friend staying across the street at the beautiful Westin. Although it was a bit harrowing to move around in this area due to all of the construction. I am sure there must be nicer rooms in this hotel, but next time I would rather stay in the nicest room of a three star hotel, then such an awful room in a 5 star one.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: sarahpWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our holiday to Dubai in late April and found the hotel to be very clean, a good base for sight seeing with very helpfull staff on hand. We stayed in 2 suites both 2 bedroom, the 1st stay was for our original booking and the 2nd was to extend our stay when British Airways cancelled our flight back home. Our 1st suite was on floor 24 and the 2nd stay was on floor 34 which had a palm view, unfortunatly the windows were dirty and the view not as good! There is building work going on around the hotel but as we were so high up the noise did'nt affect us. The rooms were huge and clean the only downside was the lack of utensils in the kitchen but this was'nt a problem as we were only in our room for breakfast and ate out the rest of the time. The staff were very friendly and helpfull right down to the request for a sewing kit being delivered in 5 mins and the front desk staff helping out with our problem with booking new airline tickets and arranging re-booking of a hotel suite at short notice. There is a free shuttle bus at the hotel but this runs at set times but we found it better to use taxis which were very cheap and ran from outside the hotel. The hotel has a car that we booked for the trip from and to the airport, this was a good price and was useful in being met at the airport as we have never been to Dubai before. There is a carrefour supermarket a two minute walk round the corner where you can buy water, tea coffee bread butter etc so breakfast can be done cheaply and then the Marina is a 5-10 min walk, here you can find a vast array of restuarants to suit any budget. The hotel is well placed for sight seeing. There are two things i would suggest is that the hotel can do..... update the advertising, we were under the impression the hotel had a uninterupted view of the palm in reality there are buildings infront of the hotel and all around. I will try to upload a picture....... and provide more sun loungers around the pool as there were very few to use.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN - DONT BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DevonCally
Reviews.Content: Our trip to this hotel was delayed by two days we could have checked in and left the rooms empty. But we knew the hotel was full and friends were struggling to extend there booking, so we called the hotel to explain that they could release our rooms for the first two nights. The Hotel was grateful for this and promised a refund for the two nights. Imagine our terror when we arrived at the hotel to be told we were a NO SHOW AND THEY WERE FULLY BOOKED!!!!! We then had to sit in reception for over an hour for my husband to arrive with email proof. The hotel then out of the blue found 2 2bedroomed appartments for us?? There was no cups, glasses, cooking pans, toilet rolls or towels. My children refused to get in the pool due to the colour ie you could not see the bottom. We still have not had our full refund for the unused nights as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Grahamwarrior
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews about this hotel on Tripadvisor, it seems that the single rooms are pretty small and cramped and the suites are amazing. We stayed in a 2 Bedroom suite on the 31st floor. The rooms are incredible, a lounge with big flat screen tv and dvd player, dining area with table and 6 chairs, a full high quality kitchen, with washing machine, dishwasher, fridge, freezer etc etc, 2 wonderfully luxurious bedrooms and 4 bathrooms. Service was fine, friendly and efficient, the pool area was lovely. I have marked the area down slightly, because of building work, but then Dubai is the worlds biggest building site and you would have the same problem in almost any hotel there. Once the work is completed, the hotel will be a 5 minute stroll to the marina and a 15 minute stroll to the beach. We strongly recomend The Tamani Marina

Reviews.Title: “big spacious and homely”
Reviews.Author: angelface1111
Reviews.Content: i read so many disappointing reviews i was worried i was going to be too....we had a two bed apartment which was huge!!! the bed was so comfortable and we had four bathrooms so we all were able to shower at same time!....there were plates, bowls and cutlery but no pans for cooking ect so used the microwave. there is a supermarket outside which is handy....the gym was well equipped, and open long hours which was great. used it every morning.....the outside pool wasnt very clean though which really disappointed me and not enough sun loungers...if this was sorted then the whole stay would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “If you're booked to the 3rd floor, check out now!”
Reviews.Author: eelnoj
Reviews.Content: I hear the building is a nice one... but what is up with the 3rd floor!? The room is very small, the room was dirty - cracked tiles, a single towel (bath only, no hand/face/etc), the bath mat was stained, when water fell from the iron and on to the floor and I wiped up the water, the towel was dirty. I managed one night, while my colleague who arrived the night before had me finding us a new hotel the next morning asap. Construction out front is still a challenge, but the concierge was not even interested in helping us get a taxi. While it was the height of tourism season and equivalently priced rooms at nearby hotels were sold out... do not stay here if you're on the 3rd floor!! We moved to the Four Points Sheraton in Downtown Dubai for AED50 more per night. Also, internet per week was more than it cost at nearby Radisson Blue or the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Tamani”
Reviews.Author: Vipini
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Tamani spacious two-bedroom apartment with my family. There indeed was 135 m2 space with livingroom/dining, kitchen, 2 bedrooms (with huge comfortable beds), 2 bathrooms and 2 toilets. We had 2 TV screens, DVD player, washing machine, dishwasher etc. Kitchen has plenty of room, but indeed not much in there. We were missing drinking glasses (had only cups). Hotel has pool area with nice indoor pools. Outdoor pool area looks nice, but pool is cold and area is windy. There are some sunbeds which you can move to side where is sun, but we didn't spend time there. There is also gym and nice restaurant. We didn't have breakfast included (room has big fridge and even freezer). Hotel staff was friendly and ready to serve. Also everything was clean. I believe you can purchase many kind of services through them. Swimming school at least looked popular. There is no bar or much space to spend times on common areas (except pool). Hotel has shuttle services, but we found it practical to take taxi in front of the hotel. Nakheel metro station you can walk to and also Marina Walk is reachable by walking. We did walk even to Marina Mall, but it is bit far away. There was specially road construction going on next to hotel, but you can find route through it even by walking. We had view to big road and some noice from traffic reached our room, but no problem with construction. Basically only complaint I have is regarding towels in room. There was only 2-3 each day even though there was 4 of us. Generally we were very happy with our hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy construction outside”
Reviews.Author: Katikinnz
Reviews.Content: I had a small studio room - very small, with a tiny bed, and construction outside started at 5am! Service was ok. No bar in the hotel, but the location was A1! I got a good deal through Expedia though - maybe the construction was the reason for the deal. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we travelled with two children the rooms are very very large.we also jused the indoorpool a lot.”
Reviews.Author: RENOUT
Reviews.Content: hotel is very close to the marine walk with lots of good restaurants. i've you want to go to the beach take the public beach next to hilton on jumairah walk is 5 min by taxi cost you about 2€. beachparc is very good as well 15 min by taxi. the metro station of nakheel is also 5 min walk wich is very easy if you want to go to the malls .every 6 or 7 min.. if you take a taxi take the one with taxi sign on the roof,much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Westin across the street!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrankaJean
Reviews.Content: Room is very very small and very pricey for a studio, by no means for the budget traveler! I walked in my room to see old chipped tiles and somewhat clean. It has a full size bed that took up the entire room which was 11x11 feet. Next to my bed was a white horribly stained lounge chair. It has a stench of cooked food, not the usual fresh sent hotel. The shower, toilet and sink are confined in a 5x5 feet bathroom so it is very tight. Shower has no doors and is 2.5x2.5 feet with a shower curtain to keep water in on 2 sides. The floor is completely wet after showering. It reminds me of a hostile more so than a hotel. There is another hotel that sits on the water across the street called Westin, it is much nicer and worth the money. The Tamani is also a dry hotel - no alcohol served. No ashtrays and one wastebasket in the bedroom. No hand towels, only a towel for the floor and shower. No hair dryer either which is pretty much the standard in this area. The only plus is there is a Carrefour grocery store just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Bookend48
Reviews.Content: Overall very disappointing and not what I was expecting from the Lastminute.com advert and the Tamani's website information. Tamani staff claimed I had booked the wrong room type. Both LM and Hotels.com clearly outline what all the rooms should include which is at odds with my experiance. More like 3 stars than 5. Room cost was allegedly reduced by 50%. Based on my experiance of other hotels/apts in Dubai would not suggest paying more than £30 - £40 this type of room. Assume the restaurants and pool etc keep rating so high. Positives: Clean hotel, Friendly staff in the fitness centre, useful Gym, Reasonably sized indoor pool. Rooms cleaned very well. Rooms quite and bright. Tea/Coffee for two cups a day. Nice outdoor pool and deck, unfortunately the area is cold and shaded as it doesn't get much sun Negatives: hotel lacks much atmosphere, Rooms very small and basic. Shower resembles 1970s mixer tap type with tray of approx 24". No bath. No Kitchen, No washing machine/drier or DVD/CD (all as claimed on Lastminute and many other booking sites no ) adverts. Good quality HD TV. Designer toiletries consist of 2" bar of soap, 1 very small Shampoo and conditioner with Tamani label. Bathroom very small. When having a shower curtain sticks to the body as tray is too small. 'fully equipped kitchen' consists of fridge with dry mini-bar, Kettle and toaster. Contrary to Tamani brochure there is no wireless around the common areas of the hotel, save to say in the room at a cost of £5 per hour (minimum time too). Free 'daily' city shuttle is provided by Burjuman centre and only runs few days a week,not daily. Far from free as soon as you get on the bus driver requested £5 tip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keys2000
Reviews.Content: I was sceptical about booking this hotel with teh mixed reviews on the internet but am glad I booked it. We booked a 2 bed apartment which was massive and has a 3rd room for Nanny. The hotel staffs were friendly and nice and very helpful. The rooms were clean and there is a cleaner that comes in every morning to also clean teh apartment. I cannot fault thsi hotel. It is close to Dubai Marina and there is a free shutlle to Mall of Emirated and Dubai Mall everyday from teh hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This isn't a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rowls-opinion
Reviews.Content: I booked through lastminute.com on a half price deal. The single studio room cost me £70 per night. My expectations were high as I had heard alot about Dubai and I expected that a 5 star hotel in Dubai would be better than 5 star hotels elsewhere. The hotel was advertised as the tallest all room hotel in Dubai. I was expecting nice views and a bit of luxury. Well it wasn't quite like that. On arrival I was a bit taken aback when they put a credit hold of 500 AED on my credit card as security against the bar fridge. I ended up with a studio room on the third floor looking out on a construction site. The room was tiny, barely room enough for the bed. The bathroom looked a bit run down and had only a shower. The shower was tiny with a flimsy shower curtain that you had to draw around the small square shower. After a 14 hour flight I was hoping to relax in a hot bath. Because of the construction happening around the site, there wasn't any place you could walk to. There were two swimming pools, one indoor and one outdoors. They were too small to do laps in. When I was checking out, I had to wait for a room check to complete to make sure I hadn't taken anything from the bar fridge (the bar fridge barely had anything in it either and would have had a max of £10 worth of bottles, if that). I would have been extremely disappointed if I had paid full price (£140), although somehow, I think that the half price offer was just a marketing stunt as the room itself should have been about £30 per night. The hotel should really be classed as a 3 star hotel. I've been to 5 star hotels and this is not one of them. On a good note, the staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: vale7373
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and it has been the worse hotel i have ever been in all my life. the room was dirty and it smelled really badly . we asked to change it and the new one was a only tiny bit better. 5 stars hotel ??? i wonder how they get them . this was maximum 2 stars. never again . valentina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: SwedishDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tamani in one of their three bedroom suites with a family of 3 children (2, 7, 9) plus our nanny. The suite was really big and clean. Great gym. Pool area is great in the afternoon but sun only available from 2 PM due to new sky scrapers next to the hotel. For us this was not a problem as we like to go to the beach in the morning and stay at the pool after lunch. To get to the beach we took a cab to JBR parking where there are a lot of nice lunch places at the Walk. There is a Carrefour just around the corner, which is convenient when travelling with kids. We did not eat dinner at the restaurant (maybe because there is no wine or beer?) but the breakfast was great with all you can expect. Overall a very nice hotel that has some excellent deals now and then on the internet. We found our "50% off during 24 hours" offer and the price could not beat anything comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here long, or again”
Reviews.Author: Bluelgt
Reviews.Content: I just checked in one of their single rooms. No hair dryer, not enough electrical outlets, TINY room, dormitory like setting. I only checked in here because the Radisson Blu was booked as well as the Marriott. I have stayed in many hotels in Dubai and this is absolutely NOT a 5 star hotel. More like 3. I will get out as soon as possible and NEVER come back here again. Very misleading web site. Also, the Internet is overpriced, even by Dubai standards at 125 DHS a day. The staff left my luggage in front of the hotel unattended and after asking three times someone finally brought it in to a secure area while I was checking in.

Reviews.Title: “didnt enjoy my stay”
Reviews.Author: orlskiee
Reviews.Content: i had stayed in many hotels over the years in dubai and thought this time i'd treat myself by staying here....big mistake. Firstly i booked it as part of a package and contacted reservations as i was arriving in dubai early but leaving at 9pm on the 3rd of nov and not the 4th as the reservation was booked for. Carla returned my first email but not the second, so i had to check into another hotel at 7am to sleep. then arriving reception were extreamly slow for checking in and out. Plus they are rude, one day i asked could i change 100dirhams (€20) into smaller notes and she refused stating they dont have change YET they do currency exchange! Restaurant staff and the food are excellent, housekeeping staff are wonderful too. All the hotel websites are out of date, especially the photos, the hotel tower is now surrounded by other towering building-most under construction, the pool is on the 4th floor and its freezing!!! the sun is blocked by all the buildings! the front of the hotel in under construcion and one has to LITERALLY jump over cactus plants in order to get a taxi, because this hotel is in the middle of nowhere-nothin is nearby walking distance!! my room was studio apartment and had a kettle and fridge-that was it!! no safe no iorn no hairdryer etc!! all the 3/4 star hotels i've stayed in previous when called themselves apartments had so much more appliances! Also every other 10 hotels i stayed in previous in dubai provided FREE bottled water and FREE internet access by having computers on display in the lobby areas. in this hotel one is expected to pay 15dirhams for small bottle water and 10 dirhams for 10mins internet access, Then the t.v channels - every second channell was static, so loads of the channels were missing or else the same channell repeated all the time. I've never before wrote a bad review for any hotel i've stayed in. But definalty spend your hard earned money elsewhere...........the facilities it offers and photos on the wesite are definalty misleading!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: terf
Reviews.Content: When at first we were booked into the Tamani we were very worried because of some of the negative reviews but I can say after 3 weeks of staying there that the negative reviews were unwarranted. The best thing about the Tamani are its staff. I'm not referring to the ones at reception and especially Not the concierge - who proved to be very unhelpful - but the lovely staff who service your rooms, who greet you at breakfast, and those from housekeeping and room service. Frecy was a lovely lady who came to clean our rooms every day and I really hope that she gets her dream of being promoted to front of house in the reception or restaurant. Then there were the staff at the restaurant who entertained our little girl for ages in the morning so we could have a decent breakfast. Bassim - thank you so much for being so helpful. Then there were the rooms. I urge you to get sea-facing room as it will spare you the construction noise from the back. The views are also amazing. But the rooms themselves are just huge. For a family there's nothing better than being able to make yourself at home away from home. The kitchen, washing machine etc were also really useful. I would say that there is a lack of utensils in the kitchen- there were no pots and pans, not even any mugs. Plus oddly, they don't provide black tea - only peppermint teabags - which for an English person proved very odd. Lucky there's a store nearby so we could stock up. The rooms themselves were spotless, and just gigantic - plenty of room to spread out. All in all this is a good option for families. I just wish front of house were as friendly as the ones who do all the hard work in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would go back again”
Reviews.Author: DH76
Reviews.Content: I was concerned by postings from other vsitors, but after a week here I can say I have no complaints at all. We have a roomy two bed apartment - would fit 4 adults easily. Large living/dining room, with huuuge TV ideal for teenagers. Bedrooms a generous size, very comfortable beds, Frette linen and towels. Two bathrooms (master en suite), a shower room and a toilet - so no arguments in the morning! Bathrooms a bit cramped, but good supply of hot water and powerful showers. Big kitchen, cooker, fridge, washing machine. If I had to nitpick, a few bits of furniture are looking a bit tired, the cupboards in the bedroom and kitchen are flatpack (not 5*), no equipment in the kitchen (but quickly supplied when asked for), and some of the grouting in the bathrooms is in need of a clean. Those are the only complaints I can find. Yes there is building work going on outside, but we were on 18th floor, so a background sound rather than a distraction or annoyance. (And I hate being disturbed in my sleep.) The staff were very welcoming, friendly, helpful. Booked tours for us, got a rental car with a couple of hours notice, told us where to go to watch camel racing - a "must see". Full daily clean of the apartment. Restaurant: generous breakfasts, good selection of hot and cold food. Didn't try evening meals - too many options outside. Location is not central Dubai, so make sure it's conveneint for your plans; however, Nakheel metro less than 10 mins walk. Good supermarket less than 5 mins walk, many restaurants at Dubai Marina about 10 mins walk also.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - great value, would defo go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn7342
Reviews.Content: This holiday was my 2nd time in Dubai, honestly i was not keen on the idea of an apartment hotel and the reviews for this hotel were very mixed but i can honestly say that it was great! We had a 2 bed apartment and it was massive!! very clean and perfect for what we needed. the view was not great but this did not bother us at all as we were out most of the time. the facilities were fine, the outdoor pool was lovely and it also had a indoor pool too for those that wanted it a bit warmer!! Staff were very friendly and helpful- any requests we had were taken care of straight away. location was again very good - anyone going to Dubai should know that you need to take taxis everywhere as it is not pedestrian friendly.it was near the beach and close the marina. the marina walk is a lovely place to go for dinner.yes there is building work near the hotel and right now the roads outside are also being worked on however this is one of the things you have to accept in dubai as it is everywhere, saying that it did not disturb us in anyway. Hotel was very clean,. Overall this is a fab hotel and very good value for money, I would defo go back again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, welcoming staff, always willing to assist. would go again, kids enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: buzygal
Reviews.Content: having read the review before i left home i was unsure what to expect- but i was pleasantly surprised. we could not believe our suite- it was spacious, 2 bedroon for a family of 4 children 12 and 10 years old. the kitchen was large- with most amenities- somethings such as pots and pans we had to request for. the washing machine was leaking but the engineer came to fix in no time at all. the room were well air-conditioned, we did not have a view of the palm, well if you want a view of the palm from your room you pay higher i suppose. the hotel provide free coach travel to major attractions such as the Atlantis, the major shopping malls, beach etc. there is a supermarket round the corner. the hotel is not close to the metro but the taxi fares are reasoable. the hotel has some bad reviews but we had a good stay, the kids spent hours in the pool, i spent time in the sauna, gym, steam room. the staff were very helpful, not sure whether it is a 4 or 5 star but we liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - But lots of Construction”
Reviews.Author: EmilyR4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tamani is a very nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and when our non-smoking room wasn't quite ready, they offered to put us in another room. Although the new room was smoking, we weren't able to tell. The front desk even called us once we settled in to make sure we were comfortable and the room didn't smell like smoke. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 4 bathroom apartment which was very spacious and clean. I would recommend this place to friends, however, maybe after the construction around the hotel is finished...it was a bit difficult to get anywhere without a taxi, even if it was within sight because of the rerouted traffic and barriers but up everywhere. There was a small grocery store within walking distance - it had everything you could need to stock the fridge in your room. Milk, breakfast foods, snacks, juice, even frozen meals. Very convenient. The only other negative was that there wasn't really a bar in the hotel that was showing sports. My friends and I were on a stopover in Dubai on our way to South Africa for the World Cup, but couldn't watch the games in our hotel. We checked at the restaurant and they sent us up to the 7th floor, but there was no sports bar to be found. We ended up going to another hotel to watch the games, so everything worked out in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Kruzzi
Reviews.Content: You can see from my reviews that I'm normally pretty generous with my ratings (or just lucky with the hotels I've stayed at). This is a bad hotel. I walked into my room and the fridge was rattling, the fittings tilted, rough looking finish, no safe. Connected to the wifi with my mobile ... then when I tried to connect with my laptop they charged me double. Never an indication that it was per device. I asked to reset the wifi so I could simply access with the laptop. The answer was simply a flat no. The room walls must be very thin since I heard the TV blaring all night from one of my neighbours. The gym was closed when a sign said it would be open. Staff were unsure of what was going on. There are too many decent hotels in Dubai to ever recommend this one to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience in ore the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Ht21
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms spacious and with four bathrooms. The views were really good of the town especially at night. A supermarket was very close by and taxis were cheap to enable us to get to town. The swimming pools were very clean and rarely full.overall we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Dubai....

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: GarryDubai
Reviews.Content: Currently relocating to the UAE i have been trying various hotels with apartments with a view to staying long term in them. On previous trips I have used the Bonnington in JLT (well worth considering) I arrived at the Tamani around 2 am to go to my apartment !! The description of the word apartment is stretched to its fullest degree in this case. It was no more than a room (I only stay in apartments so i like to think i know what to look for in the descriptions on line) The "apartment" was no more than a room with no where near the facilities described. I was collected by a friend who helped me with my bags to the room. Upon passing reception I was told (quite forcibly)that the room was only booked for one person. We continued to the room. With ajourney that can only be described as oppressive to say the least !! No more than ten minutes later the security gaurd was knocking on the door. demanding that my friend left, we both did 15 mins later (the security gaurd continued waiting outside until we left !!) I stayed elsewhere that night. the following morning i returned to speak with the manager, who at first committed to see me then sent not the Assistant Manager, not even the Front of House Manager but the assistant receptionist !! who's attitude was, to say ambivalent is a compliment ! He refused to contact Last Minute or offer any recompence up at all. 30 minutes later I had left and checked into the Bonnington. It was so bad i even mentally wrote of the money i had spent for teh months stay. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED. Last minute have since recompensed less a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Qi_Energy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel which suits all types of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Please don’t listen to the bad reviews! They are not true! Its a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: James2861
Reviews.Content: I am actually staying in this hotel as I type this review and I need to put straight any bad reviews that this hotel has been given because I genuinely feel they are misleading I was initially going to avoid booking this hotel because of the bad reviews but I made a call to the hotel and spoke to Ahmed the Director and he assured me that the hotel would be fine I went ahead and booked the hotel through lastminute.com but was really concerned that bad reviews were still appearing In a panic I sent an email to Ahmed the Director of the hotel and he again put my mind at rest So on arriving the hotel my first impressions is that it is very very clean The reception staff are very polite and courteous The room they have put me in is Fantastic The health club and spa is excellent The location is also perfect (right on the marina) There isn’t any alcohol served the hotel is a dry hotel (but that is fine for me because I don’t drink!) Ok there is some building work across the road but that is happening everywhere in Dubai. And it doesn’t disturb you at all And I am staying for 45 nights so believe me if I thought or felt for one second it was in anyway substandard for a 5 star hotel I would tell everybody In short…Great …hotel…really nice and friendly staff Mr W J Wilson

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Habibti007
Reviews.Content: What an awful hotel. My husband and I booked this hotel (a two bedroom serviced apartment) for our family visiting from the UK. The service at the front desk was appalling and shameful to say the least. My family were treated shockingly badly. The staff were rude and unhelpful. It is in the middle of a construction site and despite my family being on the 25th floor, works starting at 5am could be clearly heard from the bedrooms. The windows were filthy, the pool was freezing and the deck chairs were dusty. Check-out was a nightmare. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Not only did it ruin my family's holiday experience, it tainted their view of Dubai. At a time where the world is in the midst of a recession, hotels should be doing everything in their power to provide the best service possible for their guests, not the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - avoid if you expect good service and a clean room”
Reviews.Author: BobRobertLondon
Reviews.Content: On the face of it, this place is ok - the apartment we had was spacious and the facilities reasonable enough. The location is also pretty good with a big plus point being that Le Meridien is walking distance away for a drink and a decent meal. However, the service is absolutely abysmal - this hotel has the laziest concierge in the world and staff that can't be bothered to pick up the phone when you call down, not even for room service. Worst of all the bathroom was dirty - the floor was black when I wiped it with a tissue and the pedal bins were all broken. I was there 5 nights but never had a decent night's sleep - the thick winter duvets, completely inappropriate for a desert hotel and the construction noise (which starts at 4.30am) saw to that. Avoid and stay in a proper hotel instead!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: Slorben
Reviews.Content: This is by no means a five star hotel. The website gives you a totally wrong impression. It is not a licensed hote (no bar). Rooms are basic, everything else is basic. Pool is small. Breakfast is OK. There must be a thousand other hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: HolsteinBeer
Reviews.Content: Tamani Hotel Marina in Dubai - The room I got was more like a hostel at the price of a 4*, I tried 3 rooms but all was equally bad, and every day I heard someone complaining about room, service etc. – It ruined my trip to Dubai. Never bring someone you love to this place, it’s not a good stay. This is not good; traffic noise, the service you get, the room size and interior, price is high, cleaning and only one towel, the bed old and soft, hot water only last 5min. I am sorry to say I have travelled a lot but this is by far the worst hotel I have ever have stayed in. The strange thing is that this hotel can’t be more than 5-7years old but it looked like it had been built in the seventies and not been upgraded since. Final word of wisdom: DO NOT STAY AT THIS “HOSTEL” – GO SOMEWHERE NICE AND ENJOY THE CITY

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncrscrs
Reviews.Content: We visited Dubai in December, to break the trip to visit our grand children in Melbourne, we stayed at The Tamani Marina, and the experience was extremely pleasurable and relaxing (which is just what we needed before the 14 hour trip to Melbourne.) The suite’s are extremely large and we were pleasantly surprised by the waterfront view. We took photographs in the apartment as we want to show our kids how big the place was. We were in relax mode so we didn’t test all of the services, but everbody we met was friendly and engaging. Overall we had a chill out experience, the highlight was visiting the Burj Khalifa, which is an amazing building. My husband was an engineer before he retired so he was very interested

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay and well recommended”
Reviews.Author: Durban21
Reviews.Content: My family and I, a group of 7 passengers travelled to Dubai in Jan 2010 and we were recommended by our agent, Uniquest Travel in South Africa to stay at the the Tamani hotel marina as the hotel apartments were ideal for so many of us. It was a great stay. The hotel is ideally located in Dubai Marina around half an hour from the airport with breath taking views of Palm Jumeriah and the Atlantis. There is a supermarket behind the hotel were you can stock up on groceries, bread, cold drinks and water. The staff were ever so helpful and accommodating. We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment on the 15th floor and the apartment is extremely spacious and well decorated. We could not fault the hotel at all. The apartment had 1 room with twin beds, 2 rooms with queen beds and 3 bathrooms. They also had a laundry room and guest toilet with shower. The kitchen was huge and fully equipped with plates, cups, etc as well as a mini bar. If you wanted to cook, all you need to do is ring up housekeeping and they will bring you the pots etc that you need. However, as we were on holiday we did not opt for the self catering option but instead bought whatever we needed and had this in pur apartment. The hotel restuarant Nar and Hail is also really good and the food well presented and tasty. The hotel is close to the Marina Walk will 100's of shops and restuarants and an amazing buzz with the nigh markets on weekends. The hotel also offers a shuttle service to Atlantis, Jumeriah beach, Dubai Mall, Mall of Emirates (MOE) and more. We used this service and it was punctual and effecient. The hotel has an excellent concierge that arranged dinner for us at the Burj Al Arab. I had also read alot of reviews of how hard it was to get taxi's in Dubai but we never had a problem and the 7 of us used one MPV. The hotel had taxi's available all the time outside of the reception and getting around was no problem. We took the shuttle to the MOE and than a taxi back. The mall had an extremely effecient way of handling the taxi's and directing the people. Since they only had a normal size car and we needed a MPV, they guy at the taxi stand called for a MPV and we got one within 5 minutes. It was amazing. Tamani hotel is definitely a family friendly hotel and good value for money. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely return to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for couples & families”
Reviews.Author: Calrav
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places I visited. The staff, services, location is superb! We will definitely come again

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel in a Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: LeBonVoyager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very pleasant experience at the Tamani hotel. It was very clean and the restaurant there is excellent. It is directly across from the beach, beach resorts, and entertainment. There is a local 24-hour convenience store, a pharmacy, and salon/spa opening shortly. They have a shuttle that takes you for free to all of the main attractions, although the times that it comes and goes are limited. My only complaint was the concierge could have been more helpful planning our excursions. Highly recommend the suites... very luxurious with a full kitchen and washing machine. The fitness center is also very nice and opens early/late. There is a deck pool, but it was a bit too cold outside in late December to use it. Dubai is a very unique experience, very safe, and certainly worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “This is at best a 3-star and could use some customer service techniques.”
Reviews.Author: lotozzi
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the location of this hotel but not the staff or service. We stayed 5 nights and each day I had to call housekeeping for one thing or another, towels, toilet paper, adaptors because there are too few electrical outlets. Housekeeping was abominable, the same dirt and hair on the bathroom floor when I arrived was there when I checked out. After the 3rd night the top sheet of the king bed was removed and not replaced. Complimentary water was only for the first day we were told. The kitchen is not fully stocked, there is no cookware or serving ware. The refrigerator was not fully stocked, i had to call for them to bring the 'mini bar' items. Every time we passed through the lobby we were ignored by front desk staff, no acknowledgment at all. Upon check out we inadvertently left items in the bedside table. 3 calls were made all resulting in the same answer: "nothing has been turned in". How do we know they even looked? General Mgr. "investigated" and came back with the same response. Based on the poor housekeeping the items may be there forever with out being discovered. Positives are room size for a family to be together and free parking but that's all I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, do not repeat my mistake”
Reviews.Author: Miki_R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is between 3 and 4 starts, located in the center of construction site. If you want to walk around just forget it. During our 3 days stay, they cleaned the room and replace towels only on our call. At the end they try to charge us for some invisible mineral water. simply DO NOT GO THERE!!!! even if the price looks affordable. This is not a value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget business option”
Reviews.Author: mgbattalia
Reviews.Content: Their 3rd floor "single" rooms are an insane deal at 250AED, they are tiny but very comfortable. Access all of the amenities of a luxury hotel and stay in the trendy marina area for around 70 US dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Tamani Marina is not a 5* hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonPinko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tamani Marina Hotel from 9/11 - 14/11. We booked it because of its star rating at a reasonable price. We have been to Dubai twice before and stayed in a different 5* hotel which was great but this hotel is definately not a five star may be 3 star the most. The staff was friendly but it lacked the luxury/style of a five star hotel. We were given a apartment with 2 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms/4 toilets which was more than what we needed. My daughter went into the shower and found the water was hot only for five minutes so shampoo in her hair had to be washed out in cold water. It was fixed after a day. The apartment came with a kitchen so we could have toast and cornflakes in the morning but cleaner did not clean the kitchen and one of the bathroom until we left some tip in the room. Before booking I called the hotel to enquired whether it was linked with a private beach and I was told it was but they failed to tell me that ther is around £30-40 charge if we wanted to use the private beach facilites so paying for 4 people twice during our time was quite a hafty hole to our pockets. We went to use the pool to be told that pool is closed for maintenance. We went again the following day but water was very cold and it was dusty so did not feel like swimming in it. The jaquizi pressure of water bubbles was very low so we decided not to use it either. I will only recommend this hotel to some one if they are not looking for a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tamani Marina ! Pleasure and hospitality all the way !”
Reviews.Author: Ketul
Reviews.Content: I am writing this message from the heart ! We enjoyed the property at the best ! Baiscally we eat "Jain Food ", i.e we are not only strict vegetarin but also do not eat underground growing vegetables such as Potato, Onion, Garlic, Carrot.. to name the few.But the head shef understood our need so well that every morning he would have either Sphegetti Or Curry and Bread (with out egg ofcource) Or any vegetable would be ready for us.Hence,We carried lot of food from India, but all returned un opened.\ The serving staff was very courtious and freindly ! Love you all ! Good Luck ! GOD Bless ! Ketul Jhatakia [--]

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice suite that suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: xotech
Reviews.Content: Nice 3 bedroom apartment has been given to us and it was very very roomy for our family. Rooms smell in lower floors while other apartments are cooking. other than that we had no problems. They changed our rooms without problem. Staff was helpful. Hotel has shuttle to almost everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: amr113
Reviews.Content: I stayed in July for a week with 3 children. We booked a two bedroom apartment with a city view. The apartment was very spacious with an ensuite master bedrooom, seperate shower and toliet for the twin rooms and another toilet facilities for any guests. There was large lounge , with a fully equiped kitchen which included a microwave, double fridge, washing machine and a dish washer. However there was very limited coffeem tea bags and milk, so had to ask for supplies. The check in and out was smooth and quick and the baggages delivered promplty. The pool area is small and located on the 4th floor. Their are two pools indoors, one outside, a fully equiped gym, sauna and steam room. Outside pool was adequate but was quite windy... There is a ladies only session from Monday to Thurs from 1000hrs to 1300hrs. The rooms were cleaned everyday with new towels and shower gels provided. The hotel provides a complementary bus service to the two near shopping centers, altantis hotel and the public beach. There is a 24 hr shop just around the cormer where you can buy all the provisions. The staff were friendly and helpful. Local attractions include dubai marina, jbr walk, where you can choose from so many restaurants. Gets very busy at weekends and evenings. Overall a very nice hotel ideal for large families.

HotelInfo.Name: Tamani Hotel Marina
HotelInfo.Address: Dubai Marina Dr | PO Box 215855, Dubai 215855, United Arab Emirates
